name: Mussels in Green-Apple Broth
recipeYield: 6 appetizer or 3 to 4 main course servings
keywords: appetizer, main course, apple, dry white wine, mussels
recipeIngredient: 1 Granny Smith apple, cored and diced

recipeInstructions.text: Warm oil in heavy 4-quart saucepan. Add shallots and cook over low heat until soft but not brown, about 8 minutes. Stir in apple, lemon zest and thyme. Season with pepper. Add wine and bring to a simmer.

Add mussels, cover and cook over medium heat until they open, about 10 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer mussels to a bowl, leaving broth in saucepan. Some of the apple will cling to mussels; that's fine. Cover mussels.
Stir butter and parsley into broth and bring back to a simmer. Spoon mussels into soup plates, ladle hot broth over and serve.
